jobs.description:
Our missionThe BienCommun Fund is a unique stakeholder in the French philanthropic ecosystem. We scale projects that transform French and European societies towards the Common Good. We act in favor of the integral development of man and a freer, more just, and unified society to be a tool for the transformation of France for the benefit of all. We support initiatives around four priorities: integral education, human growth, spirituality, solidarity, family, and heritage and culture. Concretely, we study these areas to identify problems to solve or opportunities to seize. We then design solutions and look for entrepreneurs to co-create them with us!

The reality is that international rankings highlight the decline in the academic performance of French students. According to the PISA ranking managed by the OECD, which measures and ranks the effectiveness of educational systems of 85 countries each year, France has lost 14 positions in the global mathematics ranking between 2000 and 2018. The main academic success indicators have never been more positive. The proportion of students who pass the baccalaureate has been constantly increasing to reach a record of 97.5 in 2022. The mention rate, which was 32 in 2004, is now over 67 in 2023. The institutional evaluation system is often no longer taken into account for students' passage into higher education. The reputation of the high school of origin and students' motivation dossiers weigh more in the balance and decisions are made before the baccalaureate results are released.

Our idea
We therefore want to imagine a new competence certification that is recognized and demanding to facilitate and guide student selection between secondary and higher education. The objective?
To enable schools to better know their students and reduce biases and inequalities.
To help students identify their strengths and weaknesses in each of the tested disciplines.
To support schools in adopting good evaluation and follow-up practices.

Your role as an entrepreneur is to bring your vision, energy, and passion to deepen this idea and to collaborate with us to make it a reality. More details on our incubation proposal are provided below:
1. Design a high-quality test. Involve teachers and sector actors to measure expectations and create content tailored to needs.
2. Develop a strong brand to legitimize the use of an independent test. Develop strategic partnerships with educational organizations and communicate transparently on how the test is designed, managed, and corrected.
3. Ensure the promotion and adoption of the test within higher education institutions. Create detailed reports for teachers and promote the test to parent communities to accelerate its deployment in institutions.

You are the right profile if
You have a minimum of 6 years of professional experience in demanding environments.
You have a clear head, the ability to look at the big picture, and to design a viable long-term strategy.
You enjoy getting your hands dirty, even if you are supported, you remain in control. You are not afraid to use your phone to refine your idea gradually.
You can manage multiple subjects at once. finance, HR, legal, real estate, you are able to quickly learn new subjects or seek out experts if needed.
You have a strong affinity for the education sector.

What we offer during the incubation period (3-6 months):
- A development-friendly work environment. A dedicated floor for entrepreneurs in our Paris 2 offices.
- Follow-up with the Studio team. An ongoing weekly mentoring from a Studio team member and senior operating partners available on strategy, finance, marketing.
- A network of partners and service providers available for your specific needs. From institutional and business leaders to marketing and legal experts.
- An attractive remuneration package to have the freedom of spirit during this period!

How to apply
The recruitment process consists of 6 steps that we can complete in 6 weeks: 1 HR interview, 2 Studio interviews, 1 interview with the education department head, 1 essay to present your vision of the project.
Referral method: Apply for this job.

A brief overview of the role, responsibilities, and key expectations.

Required Technical Skills:  
- N/A  

Required Soft Skills:  
- Visionary thinking  
- Strategic planning  
- Collaboration  
- Initiative  
- Problem-solving  

Preferred/Nice-to-have Skills:  
- Educational background  
- Familiarity with project management

- Years of experience: 6+ years  
- Category of experience: Senior-level  
- Specific domain experience: Demand-side experience in education and project management  

Position Details:  
- Work Location: Hybrid (part-time remote)  

Additional Information:  
The process involves a series of interviews and a presentation of your vision. Freelance contract during the incubation period, potentially transitioning to a director role post-funding. Start date is flexible.

Distance traveled refers to the total number of kilometers or miles a vehicle has covered since its manufacture. It is a key factor in assessing the vehicle's condition and determining when maintenance or repairs are needed. Fuel efficiency, measured in liters per 100 kilometers (L/100km) or miles per gallon (MPG), indicates how much fuel the vehicle consumes to cover a specific distance. A lower fuel consumption figure generally means better fuel efficiency and a more cost-effective and environmentally friendly vehicle. Both metrics are crucial for understanding a vehicle's operational efficiency and sustainability.

jobs.description:
A position at Brinks Cash Solutions Romania, which is part of the global Brinks Company (BCO) listed on the NYSE. The company specializes in cash management services including digital solutions for ATM management and cash flow. They serve financial institutions, retail businesses, government agencies, and other diverse organizations worldwide. Brinks has an operational presence in 52 countries and serves clients in over 100 international markets.

Brinks is trusted by its clients to secure their value flows in the global economy, serving more than 165 countries. Together, the Brinks team is committed to providing the best services and exceptional experience to clients. We are eager to have the right people join our team to help us achieve success and foster a culture of inclusiveness.

### Overview
We seek a trustworthy and responsible individual who is conscientious of the company's and banking industry's responsibilities through the management of cash flow that secures day-to-day commerce and ATMs.

### Required Technical Skills:  
- Not applicable

### Required Soft Skills:  
- Attention to detail  
- Security-focused mindset  
- Ability to maintain focus  
- Dynamism  
- Adaptability  
- Teamwork  
- Integrity  
- Communication  
- Problem-solving abilities  

### Preferred/Nice-to-have Skills:  
- Experience in banking or financial industries  
- Knowledge in retail operations and cash flow  
- Warehouse picking experience  
- Experience with counting equipment and handling large amounts of cash and coins  
- Financial reconciliation experience  

### Experience Requirements:  
- Years of experience: Minimum education specified  
- Specific domain experience: Retail or banking operations, experience with cash flow and handling significant amounts of cash  

### Position Details:  
- Work Location: Not specified, may involve shifts and night work  

### Additional Information:  
- Offers paid vacation, medical packages, on-call allowances, and performance bonuses. Career paths and opportunities are available.  
- Applicants must complete the entire application process to be considered.  
- All candidates will be contacted if selected.  
- Brinks is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate based on any characteristics protected by law, including gender, age, race, ethnicity, religion, national origin, social status, sexual characteristics, sexual identity, or any other protected characteristics.  
- Information on Brinks' data processing policy during the recruitment and selection process can be found [here](https://cariere.brinks.ro/nota-de-informare-prelucrare-date-personale-proces-recrutare-si-selectie).

The Brinks team is looking for a Verificator de Valori (Value Verifier) to join our secure team and play a crucial role in processing cash to keep modern commerce and ATMs running smoothly. Responsibilities include verifying cash and documents received from clients, ensuring compliance with requirements, entering data into the IT system, depositing cash in specialized secure areas, maintaining the traceability of processed values and operations, participating in cash processing and ATM loading/unloading, providing reports on discrepancies, maintaining strict compliance with standard operating and security procedures, and organizing the workspace at the end of the shift.

jobs.description:
Join the CDPQ team and take pride in contributing to the financial future of millions of Quebecers by creating a more sustainable world. The role offers opportunities to learn from experts and a world-class team environment.

#### Brief Overview
You will be part of the Sustainable Investments team, contributing to the evaluation and assessment of business partners. Responsibilities include risk assessment, verification of records, and communication with investment teams.

#### Role Responsibilities
- Coordinate or conduct background checks requested by investment teams and synthesize results by evaluating the materiality of identified risks.
- Validate the scope of required verifications according to the dossier, including the identification of related individuals or entities.
- Research information from public or private databases.
- Use rigorous and appropriate research and analytical methods to obtain the required information.
- Analyze and write a structured report evaluating the global financial security risk for simple to moderately complex files.
- Evaluate reputation risks, including money laundering and financing of terrorism (ML/FT) risks associated with the portfolio.
- Write analytical reports for senior management.
- Actively improve existing practices or develop new practices.
- Ensure good communication with investment teams for the tracking and prioritization of their requests.
- Train and sensitize teams concerning the policies and procedures of record reviews.
- Collaborate with the Sustainable Investments team.
- Continuously monitor industry best practices.
- Participate in special projects within the organization.

#### Required Skills
- Bachelor’s degree in a relevant field such as security studies, policing, law, forensics, accounting, finance, journalism, or investigative studies.
- At least 6 years of relevant experience.
- CFE or CAMS certification is an asset.
- Understanding of financial client risk management.
- Knowledge of reputation or non-financial risks.
- Strong synthesis and communication skills, autonomous, innovative, and dynamic.
- Proficiency in Microsoft Office applications.
- Analytical mindset, rigor, and judgment.
- Ethical sense and discretion.
- Excellent organizational, initiative, and scheduling skills.
- Ability to set priorities and deadlines.
- Superior command of French, and good command of English.

#### Preferred Skills
- Ambition, accountability, openness, and collaboration.
- Critical analysis, rigour, and decision-making ability.
- Continuous learning and professional development.

#### Experience Requirements
- Years of experience: 6+
- Specific domain experience: Risk management, financial client risk, and industry best practices.

#### Position Details
- Work Location: Onsite

#### Additional Information
- Provides a professional experience combining importance, fun, and growth. Compensation reflects contributions.
- Encourages applications from women, visible minorities, Indigenous people, and individuals with disabilities.

jobs.description:
Silae, the first French and leading payroll software company in France, accelerates its growth with its SaaS HR management solutions, My Silae, Silae RH Suite. Silae is part of Silver Lake, an investment firm associated with the most significant technological transformations of recent years.

#### Overview
Silae, with 400 employees spread across multiple sites in France (Aix-en-Provence, Bordeaux, Lyon, Nantes, Rennes, Toulouse, Paris, Montpellier, Brest), operates within a dynamic and participative corporate culture in a sector undergoing constant evolution.

#### Role
CSM (Customer Success Manager) plays a crucial role in achieving partner satisfaction and loyalty by ensuring they fully utilize their services and solutions effectively.

#### Responsibilities
- Accompany partners throughout their journey, ensuring their satisfaction and proper use of our solutions.
- Answer partners' questions, maintaining fluid and proactive communication.
- Analyze partners' needs and propose adapted solutions to optimize their experience.
- Participate in onboarding for new partners using our products and services.
- Regularly follow up with partners to collect feedback and identify improvement opportunities.
- Collaborate closely with commercial and technical teams to solve problems reported by partners and their clients.
- Help establish tools and processes to enhance customer satisfaction.
- Contribute to creating guides and support materials for partners and the CSM team.

#### Role Location
Lyon or Aix-en-Provence.

#### Required Skills
- Sens of communication.
- Detail-oriented and client satisfaction-oriented.
- Strong interpersonal skills, active listening, and problem-solving capabilities.
- Autonomous and proactive, with a good team spirit.
- Excellent communication skills and interest in interacting with clients.
- Previous client-facing experience is a plus.

#### Experience Requirements
- Graduate with a Bac 3 (approx. 3 years of education) or higher.

#### Position Details
- Work Location: Hybrid (2 days in office)

#### Additional Information

jobs.description:
Are you looking to gain real-life industry experience and prove yourself to future employers?

Cirium Ascend is seeking an enthusiastic junior or graduate intern to join our team this summer. About the Business: Cirium keeps the world connected by providing aviation analytics, helping customers understand the past, present, and predict the future. Cirium Ascend offers aviation market intelligence, advisory services, and valuations. The team consists of over 30 employees based globally, providing reliable insights to accelerate digital transformation in the aviation industry.

About the Role: As an intern with Cirium Ascend, you will assist with aviation valuations and market studies. Responsibilities include researching and analyzing data, performing market reviews, and supporting advisory projects. You will also assist with routine maintenance of databases and internal projects. This is an exciting opportunity to gain real-life work experience and prove yourself to future employers.

Position Details: 
- Work Location: New York City

Additional Information: 
- Duration of internship: Flexible but a minimum of two months. Ideally, three months.
- Starting date of internship: Flexible, but from May 2025 onwards earliest.

Responsibilities:
- Collecting and processing data to support valuations and market studies.
- Analyzing aircraft transaction data and producing charts with value trends.
- Performing market reviews on an aircraft-type basis and proposing revised values.
- Researching potential methods of statistically estimating future aircraft values and lease rates.
- Assisting with advisory projects, market updates, presentations, and webinars.
- Reviewing internal databases to ensure maintenance costs for all aircraft are up to date.
- Supporting internal projects such as reviewing, organizing, sanitizing, and analyzing data sets.

Requirements:
- Numerate background in engineering, mathematics, statistics, data science, or accounting.
- University/college student or recent graduate.
- Proficient in Microsoft Excel and working knowledge of SQL and Python.
- Good communication skills and keen interest in aviation.
- Attention to detail and ability to process large volumes of data.
- Capability or eagerness to develop and safeguard a viewpoint.

Salary: $28/hour

Additional Information: 
- Paid internship that includes a grant from the ISTAT Foundation.
- Diverse and inclusive work environment.
- Equal opportunity employer.
jobs.short_description: Intern at Cirium Ascend for aviation valuations and market studies. Analyze data, perform market reviews, and assist with internal projects. Requires numerate background, Excel proficiency, and interest in aviation. Paid internship, flexible 2-3 months, starting May 2025.

jobs.description:
Join VusionGroup to shape the future of retail! As a leading retail tech company with operations in 19 countries across 3 continents, we are revolutionizing physical commerce through IoT and data solutions. At VusionGroup, we believe that entrepreneurship is a calling, and our startup spirit fuels your ambition. Belive.ai, our AI and image analysis platform, helps retailers manage their stores in real-time, enhancing team efficiency and providing real-time data access. In the Belive.ai development team, you will design, develop, and maintain web applications using the company's PHP, JS stack, ensuring code quality through best practices.

Develop and maintain web applications using PHP, JS, and CodeIgniter framework. Ensure code quality through best practices. Manage Git flows for version control, document and track code changes. Set up and maintain automated deployment pipelines. Conduct unit, integration, and functional tests. Collaborate closely with team members to find efficient and innovative solutions. Qualifications: Bachelor's in computer science, software development, or equivalent. Minimum 3 years of software development experience. Fluent in English (reading, writing, speaking).
